timeline.message:
Add PubSub integration tests

- PubSubEmulatorApplicationContextInitializer sets up pubsub emulator container
- Adds vanilla test - PubSubRecordParserTest
- Use postgres:9.6-alpine in circleci to match developer local env (docker-compose)

Signed-off-by: Apekshit Sharma <apekshit.sharma@hedera.com>

timeline.bodyText: Why cannot all integration tests extend from IntegrationTest (RecordParserDisabledTest, PubSubIntegrationTest)? Spring Boot should be smart enough to know that it needs to load a new or partial application context depending upon the annotations present. That way the common annotations can all stay in IntegrationTest like cache, database, kubernetes.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: Ah, didn't know @SpringBootTest could work like that. Done now.
replies.author: apeksharma

timeline.bodyText: Should be abstract. IntegrationTest should also be abstract
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: What's the advantage of making them abstract when they don't have any abstract function?
replies.author: apeksharma

replies.bodyText: An abstract class just means it can't be instantiated on its own, not necessarily that it contains abstract methods. It's considered good practice since this class is not standalone but intended to be used through inheritance only. Also, if we had @Test in it JUnit might run it multiple times: once standalone and N times for each subclass.
replies.author: steven-sheehy
